title: 106_hr1986
content: Exclusion from gross income of qualified lessee construction allowances not limited to short-term leases. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code allows qualified lessee construction allowances for retail space leases. Conforming amendments are made to related sections. Effective date applies to leases after enactment of the Act. Exclusion from gross income for contributions to the capital of retailers. The amendment to Section 118 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes a safe harbor provision for contributions to retailers who agree to operate a qualified retail business at a specific location for at least 15 years. The amendment to Section 118 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 provides a safe harbor provision for contributions to retailers who agree to operate a qualified retail business at a specific location for at least 15 years. Taxpayers can use the contributed amount to acquire ownership of land for their retail business, subject to certain expenditure rules. The safe harbor provision in the amendment to Section 118 of the Internal Revenue Code allows contributions to retailers operating a qualified retail business at a specific location. The business must sell tangible personal property to the general public, and expenditures must occur within two years of receiving the contribution. Accurate records of contributions and expenditures must be maintained. The amendment to Section 118 of the Internal Revenue Code allows contributions to retailers selling tangible personal property to the general public. Special rules apply to leases of land and controlled groups for tax purposes. The amendment to Section 118 of the Internal Revenue Code treats all taxpayers as a single employer and disallows deductions or credits for contributions to capital. The adjusted basis of property acquired with these contributions is reduced. Rules similar to the preceding sentence apply to retailers selling tangible personal property. The amendments to Section 118 of the Internal Revenue Code disallow deductions or credits for contributions to capital. Rules similar to the preceding sentence apply to amounts received after the date of the enactment of this Act.
